headline: Exxon, Chevron turn page on legal fight as profits slip
summary:
Lower crude prices dented profits at ExxonMobil and Chevron as the companies signaled Friday they are moving past a legal fight over an acquisition ultimately won by the latter firm.- Closing the gap -
But Chevron CEO Mike Wirth said the company expects to end 2025 close to four million barrels per day following the completion of its $53 billion acquisition of US company Hess, which was delayed for more than a year following a legal spat with ExxonMobil.

raw.headline: Exxon, Chevron turn page on legal fight as profits slip
raw.summary:
Lower crude prices dented profits at ExxonMobil and Chevron as the companies signaled Friday they are moving past a legal fight over an acquisition ultimately won by the latter firm.- Closing the gap -
But Chevron CEO Mike Wirth said the company expects to end 2025 close to four million barrels per day following the completion of its $53 billion acquisition of US company Hess, which was delayed for more than a year following a legal spat with ExxonMobil.

headline: Exxon, Chevron top Q2 estimates: Key takeaways
summary: Exxon (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported second quarter profits at four-year lows but still topped estimates as oil (CL=F, BZ=F) production climbed. Fernando Valle, Hedgeye Risk Management Energy Analyst, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré discuss how M&A and shale dominance could drive future growth despite soft prices. headline: Coinbase, ExxonMobil & Chevron, Moderna: Trending Tickers
summary: Coinbase (COIN) shares are under pressure after a drop in adjusted profit, with sluggish retail crypto trading volumes despite rising crypto prices. ExxonMobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported steep profit declines in the second quarter, though both topped revenue expectations as oil production hit record levels. Moderna (MRNA) reported a smaller loss than expected in Q2 but lowered the high-end of its full-year revenue outlook amid shipment delays to the UK. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Q2 profits at Exxon Mobil and Chevron dip to lowest level in 4 years on subdued energy prices
summary: Exxon Mobil’s second-quarter profit dropped to the lowest level in four years and sales fell as oil prices slumped as OPEC+ ramped up production.  Exxon earned $7.08 billion, or $1.64 per share, for the period ended June 30.  A year earlier it earned $9.24 billion, or $2.14 per share.

headline: How Moscow might respond if Trump stops Russian oil to India
summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -U.S. President Donald Trump's demand on India to halt Russian oil imports could threaten billions in Russian revenues, prompt Moscow to retaliate by stopping a major U.S.-led oil pipeline and potentially lead to a new global supply crisis.  India, the world's third largest oil importer, has become the biggest buyer of Russian oil since 2022, purchasing up to 2 million barrels per day of oil accounting for 2% of global supply.

headline: Chevron beats Wall Street profit estimates with record output
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -Chevron beat analyst estimates for second-quarter profit on Friday as record oil and gas production and lower capital expenditure helped to offset the impact of lower crude prices.  The No. 2 U.S. oil major last month headed off a legal challenge from the biggest U.S. producer Exxon Mobil enabling it to close its $55 billion acquisition of Hess.  The deal includes a stake in the Stabroek Block oilfield, offshore Guyana, that Exxon operates, and should provide Chevron with a source of long-term growth to help to fund dividends into the 2030s and make Chevron's earnings more resilient to oil price volatility.

raw.headline: Chevron beats Wall Street profit estimates with record output

The deal includes a stake in the Stabroek Block oilfield, offshore Guyana, that Exxon operates, and should provide Chevron with a source of long-term growth to help to fund dividends into the 2030s and make Chevron's earnings more resilient to oil price volatility.

headline: Chevron Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: HOUSTON, August 01, 2025--Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) reported earnings of $2.5 billion ($1.45 per share - diluted) for second quarter 2025, compared with $4.4 billion ($2.43 per share - diluted) in second quarter 2024. Included in the quarter was a net loss of $215 million related to the fair value measurement of Hess Corporation shares, and company pension curtailment costs, partly offset by a gain on the sale of certain non-operated U.S. pipeline assets. Foreign currency effects decreased

The company’s balance sheet is a key strength that investors shouldn’t ignore. […]
